intro: Anacamptis × timbali nothosubsp. albuferensis, commonly known as the Albufera marsh orchid, is a hybrid orchid native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pale purple to white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland and marsh habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces a single spike of flowers with elongated, spurred petals. This nothosubspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
